alert.note: Alert for Carter; Coal; Garvin; Johnston; Marshall; Murray; Pontotoc (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 04 at 9:12PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM CDT THURSDAY... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Continued flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...Portions of east central and southern Oklahoma, including the following counties, in east central Oklahoma, Pontotoc. In southeast Oklahoma, Coal, Johnston and Marshall. In southern Oklahoma, Carter, Garvin and Murray. * WHEN...Until 115 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 909 PM CDT, Although the heavier rain has ended, between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen today. Additional rainfall amounts of less than an inch are expected the rest of the evening, keeping the concern for flooding going into the overnight hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ardmore, Sulphur, Madill, Tishomingo, Davis, Lone Grove, Dickson, Mannsville, Roff, Springer, Ravia, Stonewall, Mill Creek, Milburn, Fitzhugh, Dougherty, Bromide, Gene Autry, Hickory and Scullin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Carter; Coal; Garvin; Johnston; Marshall; Murray; Pontotoc
